metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13233 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In arch/x86/lib/insn-eval.c in the Linux kernel before 5.1.9, there is a use-after-free for access to an LDT entry because of a race condition between modify_ldt() and a #BR exception for an MPX bounds violation. Jann Horn discovered a use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel when accessing LDT entries in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13233` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49').
